intro: Scleria aureovillosa, commonly known as the golden-haired sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like leaves and spike-like inflorescences, with small, three-lobed flowers. Its leaves are often covered in golden or pale-colored hairs, giving it its common name. Scleria aureovillosa typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or grassland habitats.
